answerText: Kalidasa[10] This lyric poem by Kalidasa sees an exiled Yaksha convince the titular entity to contact his wife by telling him how fun it is to fly around the mountains.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Stanford A and Maryland A and University of Illinois at Chicago | 17 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One of this man's major poetic works concerns the birth of a war god, and utilizes the competing rasa of love and rasa of heroism. FTPE:  [10] Identify this author of The Birth of Kumara and The Exposition of the Seasons who also wrote about a ring that enables the title action after being eaten by a fish in The Recognition of Shakuntala.
